turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Cayuse people.
turn.1: When did the Cayuse people settle in Northern California?
turn.2: Crowds of whites invaded the region during the California Gold Rush beginning in 1848 and when gold was discovered in Eastern Oregon in 1862.
turn.3: Was there any other tribes in the area?
turn.4: The tribe gained wide notoriety in the early days of the white settlement of the territory.
turn.5: Did they have any struggles with the white settlers?
turn.6: In 1838, Marcus Whitman and his wife Narcissa established a mission among the Cayuse at "Waiilatpu" ("Place of the Rye Grass"), a site about seven miles from the present-day city of Walla Walla and about a quarter mile east of where the Cayuse "Pásxa" winter village was located.
turn.7: Did they lose any members due to the illness?
turn.8: In 1847, a measles epidemic, suspected by some to be contracted from white settlers, resulted in high fatalities among the tribe.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: A small group of Cayuse, after putting Witmans medicine to the test with both sick and non sick individuals, and which all test individuals died, believed the missionaries were deliberately poisoning their native people, since a much higher percentage of the natives were dying from the measles than were the whites.
turn.11: Did they have any vaccinations against the illness?
turn.12: (Native Americans had no immunity to the endemic Eurasian diseases carried by European Americans.)
